column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3. Results and Discussion
#Text=During the reaction , the waste liquids were dropped on the metal spoon and placed in a vertical tube furnace .
#Text=The effects of droplet quality , heating temperature , atmosphere , and other conditions on the expansion characteristics and expansion time were investigated .
#Text=The volume expansion of the waste liquid droplets after heating in the vertical tube furnace is shown in
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=.
#Text=As the droplet length increased with an increase in the heating time , the volume first increased and then became smaller , and the maximum volume appeared in the middle .
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=shows the expansion index under a nitrogen atmosphere .
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=a shows the effect of furnace temperature on the expansion index , and
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=b is the effect of droplet mass on the expansion index .
#Text=Tests showed that the overall expansion index of the droplets increased with increasing temperature , while the index of droplet expansion varied little with mass .
#Text=The expansion process of the droplets at high temperatures was accompanied by the evaporation of water , the precipitation of volatiles , and multiphase chemical reactions .
#Text=The surface temperature of the droplet rose very quickly .

#Text=The surface of the droplets was volatilized to analyze the volume expansion during this process to form hollow microspheres , which increased the heat and mass transfer efficiency of the surface .
#Text=The residual carbon on the surface of the droplet reacted with the internal moisture by self-gasification ( C + H2O → CO + H2 ) .
#Text=The higher the furnace temperature , the more obvious was the reaction .
#Text=This significantly changed the pore structure of the droplets , which was beneficial to the volume expansion of the droplets .
#Text=At 600 °C , the droplets were mainly precipitated by moisture and some volatiles .
#Text=The reaction process was slow , and it remained difficult to form porous solid particles ; the expansion index was also relatively small .
#Text=Figure 7
#Text=shows the distribution index of waste liquid expansion under an air atmosphere .

#Text=The droplet expansion index decreased first and then increased with an increase in furnace temperature and decreased slightly with an increase in the droplet quality , but the amplitude was small .

#Text=When the droplets were heated in an air atmosphere , the expansion characteristics of the waste liquid became complicated due to the participation of O2 in the air , especially at high temperatures .
#Text=Chemical reactions , including C/CO2 , C/O2 , and C/Na , were also considered .
#Text=During the test , no fire was observed when the furnace temperature was 600 °C .

#Text=When the temperature was above 700 °C , an obvious flare was observed , indicating that the expansion process of the waste liquid at a high temperature was accompanied by a violent combustion reaction .

#Text=When the furnace temperature was less than 600 °C , the expansion process of the droplets was mainly due to the evaporation of water and pyrolysis of the waste liquid , which caused the droplet volume to increase sharply .

#Text=However , when the droplet size increased , the specific surface area decreased , the heat transfer and mass transfer became slower , and the oxidation of the air formed a dense shell on the surface of the droplet , which hindered the volume expansion of the droplet .

#Text=When the furnace temperature was 700 – 1000 °C , the droplet evaporation and small molecule evaporation analysis time was very short — that is , by entering the macromolecular pyrolysis stage , a large amount of gas was released and accompanied by combustion , and the droplet expansion index reached the maximum value .
#Text=When the mass of the droplet increased , the precipitation inside the droplet was weaker than the combustion reaction on the surface , and the droplet expansion index became smaller .
#Text=However , as the sodium salt melt began to react with the char , the expansion index of the large mass droplets increased .
#Text=As shown in
#Text=Figure 7
#Text=and
#Text=Figure 8
#Text=, the variation index of the expansion index of the liquid droplets under an inert atmosphere and oxidizing atmosphere was completely different .
#Text=The volume expansion of the droplets under an inert atmosphere was mainly the effect of moisture evaporation and volatilization analysis .
#Text=The higher the temperature , the faster the volatile analysis and the larger the SVI index .
#Text=Under an oxidizing atmosphere , the expansion of droplets was related to the analysis of moisture and volatilization as well as the participation of oxygen around the droplets .
#Text=The influencing factors increased , and the regularity of SVI was not affected by temperature .
#Text=Figure 8
#Text=shows the maximum swelling volume index ( SVImax ) as a function of temperature and mass under nitrogen and air atmospheres .
#Text=Figure 8
#Text=a considers the effect of temperature on SVImax , while
#Text=Figure 8
#Text=b considers the effect of mass on SVImax .

#Text=As can be seen from the figure , the maximum expansion index under a nitrogen atmosphere was substantially larger than that of the air atmosphere except at a lower temperature and a lower mass .
#Text=This shows that , due to the presence of air , the surface of the droplet reacted with oxygen , destroying the porous structure of the droplet and reducing the maximum expansion index .
